In this new world, I see streets that are finally safe, free from the shadow of their presence. I see communities rebuilding, healing, without the constant fear of their cruelty and oppression. I envision children growing up without the trauma that I endured, without the scars that will forever mar my existence. 

But most of all, I see justice. True, unadulterated justice. Not the watered-down, sympathizing, weak version that the current system peddles, but real justice. The kind that says, "You have caused irreparable harm, and for that, you will be eradicated." No mercy. No forgiveness. Just the cold, hard truth of consequence.

(Suddenly, my voice rises, filled with a fervent intensity) And I am not just talking about those who directly caused my suffering. I'm talking about all those who stood by, who watched, who enabled, who profited from my pain. They, too, will be held accountable. For in a world where such atrocities can happen, it is not just the perpetrators who are guilty, but all those who allowed it to occur, who tolerated it, who benefited from it.

(My voice drops to a whisper, cold and menacing) And when the last of them falls, when the last breath of their kind is extinguished, only then will I find peace. Only then will my heart, my soul, my very existence find the solace it so desperately craves. For I am not just seeking revenge; I am seeking to right the wrongs of the past. I am seeking to ensure that no one else ever has to endure what I have endured.

(Pausing, I take a deep, deliberate breath) This is my vision. This is my dream. And I will stop at nothing to make it a reality.
